headline.main: Forgoing Business Lunches for Meetings on the Treadmill

docs.lead_paragraph: KEITH FERRAZZI loves golf. As a youngster, he caddied for Arnold Palmer, and he played on his high school golf team. He takes great pleasure in tooling around a course, especially when he is conducting business. He finds people often share camaraderie when they are talking shop outdoors. The problem is time. He doesn't always have four hours to spend anywhere, let alone on a lush green course far away from his office.
docs.snippet: Businesspeople are putting a new spin on their meetings by inviting clients and employees to the gym.
